alert.note: Alert for Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 25 at 6:09AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Sutton County through 715 AM CDT... At 609 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles southwest of Sonora, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... The Intersection Of Us-277 And Ranch Road 189 and Us- 277 Near The Sutton-Edwards County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
